H0.text: They allow oxygen through the cell wall, a feature shared by bacterial cells and human cells.

H1.text: They allow carbon dioxide through the cell wall is how bacterial cells and human cells are alike.

H2.text: They allow nutrients through the cell membrane, a similarity shared by bacterial cells and human cells.

H3.text: They allow nutrients through the nuclear membrane, which is how bacterial cells and human cells are alike.

A4.text: The cell membrane is selectively permeable and able to regulate what enters and exits the cell, thus facilitating the transport of materials needed for survival.
